titleInfo.title: Wind and warmth in virtual reality: implementation and evaluation

name.namePart: Virtual Reality International Conference: Laval Virtual

mods.abstract: One possibility to make virtual worlds more immersive is to address as many human senses as possible. This paper presents the development of a system for creating wind and warmth simulations in Virtual Reality (VR). Therefore, suitable hardware and an implemented software model are described. Technical evaluations of the hardware and of the software components demonstrate the usability of the system in VR Applications. Furthermore, a user study underlines users’ acceptance and indicates a positive influence of wind and warmth stimuli on perceived presence.
